results.title: Mecca: the forbidden city
results.brief_description: The world’s 600 million Muslims are expected to make the pilgrimage to Mecca at least once in their lives. The film traces the ritual of the progress from Medina to Mecca, during which various rites are performed at the stopping places. A glimpse is given of the catering arrangements for 1,500,000 people, mostly men. The pilgrims enter the great Mosque where the sacred Ka’aba stands, centre of their devotions.

results.title: Meat and poultry: how to select them
results.creator_credit: Tim Baar, FilmFair Communications and Bruce A. Block
results.brief_description: Uses a young reporter’s interview with a butcher to show consumers how to select the best quality meat and poultry for their needs. Shows how to recognise desirable characteristics of chicken and such meats as veal, lamb, beef, pork and mince. Provides a variety of tips, along with hints on cooking cheaper cuts.

results.title: Measuring the Univese
results.brief_description: Explains how astronomers measure the brightness of stars and calculate their distance from Earth. Stars are classified by the spectrums their light produces, and this real brightness in conjunction with the apparent brightness enables measurement - even of stars outside our own galaxy.

results.title: Measuring short distances
results.creator_credit: Educational Services Incorporated and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Starts with the centimetre scale, moves on to microscopic dimensions and then to the dimensions of atoms by means of Erwin Mueller’s field emission microscope. Shows how calibration of instruments can give us accurate knowledge of these small distances.

results.title: Measuring matter: Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Bill Walker Productions, Bill Walker and Peter Dallas
results.brief_description: This entertaining video which uses an animated investigator Al the Alligator to explain questions of physics. Part one ‘Volume’ sees Al investigating the “Case of the mysterious Puddle of Water: to explain that volume means the space that matter takes up. Part two has Al investigating the “Case of the Falling Picture” where he discovers the effect that temperature has on solids, and liquids, eg. that ice becomes water or steam depending on the temperature. Suitable for Primary level students.

results.title: Measuring matter: Volume 1
results.creator_credit: Bill Walker Productions, Bill Walker and Peter Dallas
results.brief_description: This entertaining video which uses an animated investigator Al the Alligator to explain questions of physics. Part one ‘Length’ sees Al investigating the “The Case of the missing running shoe” to solve the mystery of length, using only a metre stick. Part two ‘Mass’ has Al investigating what mass is. He learns to measure Mass and Matter using a tool for this, a balance. He learns that matter has mass and weight, but weight may change depending on the location of the matter. Suitable for Primary level students.
